name: Andy's Adventure
description:
My first attempt at creating a game using Unity Engine, for my Game & App Development class!

Most details are in the in-game pause menu, but here are some extra things I should mention.

- The stars vertically rotating around the moon are 'guardian stars', which will decrease your score and knock you back if you collide with them. Although they're pretty high up, and it's difficult enough to reach the moon, so you probably won't have to worry about those.

- The damn game changes it's behavior depending on what resolution and quality you're playing on. I built the game on 2560x1440 resolution (fullscreen & ultra quality), so it probably works best with those settings. However, I've tested a few other resolution settings, and these are the ones that are still playable (meaning, it's still possible to beat the game, but it's a biiiiiiit harder because you're slower and your jump is weaker. For this reason, I added a cheat key, which increases your speed and your jump power if you press it! Key is indicated in the pause menu. ;3c)

WORKING RESOLUTIONS (If you for whatever reason actually play my game  and you find other playable resolution settings, please list them in the comments! Or don't. I really don't care.)

- 1920 x 1080, Medium Graphics, Fullscreen

-1920x1080, High Graphics, Windowed

- 1600x900, High Graphics, Windowed

That's pretty much it, I guess. Have fun?
